stories.title: Kyu-Shirataki Train Station in Hokkaido, Japan, Closes After Student Graduates

stories.text:
I'm pretty sure yesterday I can use ``` (triple backtick) to indicate a code snippet, but today the function is disabled. I checked the other code snippet functionality (that you can access from Format->Code snippet) and its interface is changed so I figured this must be an implicit corporate update that went off the radar.

My question is: I'm getting enough of this, and TBH I don't give it a fuck about corporate IT policy if it constantly gets in my way. Is there anyway to hack it to just completely prevent ANY update on Microsoft products on MacOS?
stories.title: MS Teams macOS recent update seems to disable the quick code snippet functio

stories.text:
I might put off the decision making of the Document Recovery task too often, but as a result I've noticed how often I have to thoughtfully select 'Yes' before closing Excel/Word. If the default were 'Yes, I want to view this files later." then I could just click OK.

This default seems to go against the norm in software of making the user actively select delete/remove.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why is the MS default: No, remove the files?
